summary: The Consumer Online Payment Transparency and Integrity Act (S. 2266) aims to protect consumers from deceptive automatic renewal practices. The bill mandates clear disclosure of automatic renewal terms, including free-to-pay conversions and negative options. It requires businesses to notify consumers before renewals, obtain express consent, and provide easy cancellation methods. Violations result in contract termination and refunds. The bill also addresses "dark patterns" and grants enforcement powers to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC). The bill's target is consumer protection.
